1.definition: capable of being easily seen, perceived, or discovered [ defects] [ ambiguity]

2.definition: having a right to succeed to a title or estate that cannot be defeated

3.definition: appearing to one's senses and esp. one's vision or to one's understanding as real or true on the basis of evidence that may or may not be correct or factual [an ability to cause injury] [the scope of the agent's authority]
